title: Cat tax? çŒ«ç¨ï¼Ÿ
text:
Chinese Friends, why do you ask for the "cat tax"?
ä¸­å›½æœ‹å‹ä»¬ï¼Œä½ ä»¬ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆè¦æ±‚å¾æ”¶â€œçŒ«ç¨â€å‘¢ï¼Ÿ
I understand that cats are very cute and here in America we too enjoy looking at cats. I am curious however if the cat tax is a cultural thing, or simply a joke that has arisen with the influx of Americans into xiaohongshu?
 
Also, in America we have slang where we call cats cars, as the letter r is right next to t on our keyboards, so it is a common spelling error that many have started to do on purpose, since the noise a cat makes is similar to a car engine. Is there a similar slang in Mandarin? Thanks!

Hi, friends from Tiktok
 
It's me, Toast, the most charming one - year - old golden shaded British shorthair you'll ever meet.

I hope you enjoy my pictures as much as I enjoy being this cute! Follow me if you do think so!!!

title: about cat tax
text:
#cattax #TikTok #tiktok
When American friends first came here, they all said that sending photos of cats is "cat tax". Although I know it's just a friendly joke. But in fact, no Chinese will associate sending photos and paying taxes. This makes me feel that taxes are everywhere in American life, and the payment of taxes has been engraved in the bones of the American people. The key is that the taxes they pay are not used in the public sphere and have all gone into the pockets of capitalists.

text:
I feed some cats in my neighborhood. The orange one on the left is Ginger. The orange one on the right is Vanilla. He is very friendly. Cats and Dogs Unite the Global Village
In the lively Global Village of Xiaohongshu, the natives showed off their humor and brilliance. When TikTok â€œrefugeesâ€ flooded in, searching for a new home, Xiaohongshu residents swiftly introduced a playful policy: the â€œCat & Dog Tax.â€
Whatâ€™s the Cat & Dog Tax? Simple: to prove your sincerity and creativity, you must post heartfelt content about cats or dogsâ€”one genuine â€œtribute to the mastersâ€ was your ticket to officially settle down.
TikTok newcomers embraced the challenge, creating cat videos, dog memes, and even waging a â€œpet video arms race.â€ Meanwhile, the cats and dogs basked in newfound fame, becoming the true superstars of the village.
In the end, the Cat & Dog Tax not only helped integrate TikTok users but also made Xiaohongshu an even more vibrant and united Global Village. Together, natives and newcomers bonded over adorable pets, proving that globalization can be as fun and wholesome as cuddling with a furry friend.

Recently, when browsing Xiaohongshu, I found many accounts claiming to be foreigners. The content is diverse, including sharing foreign foods and sceneries, and introducing exotic cultural customs. If it's a real foreigner starting an account, it may bring some fresh perspectives and real foreign experiences, allowing us to understand the world without leaving home. But if it's a fake foreigner starting an account, isn't it a bit deceptive and misleading our understanding of foreign countries?
Have you ever come across any foreign accounts that make you doubt their authenticityğŸ§? Come and chat together, and share some tips for distinguishing. Maybe we can all develop a pair of sharp eyesğŸ˜œ!

title: The word â€œforeignerâ€ is outdated
text:
I spent 14 years living in China, and one word that consistently grated on me was "foreigner." It always felt like a label, a box I was being placed in, rather than a recognition of my individual identity.
The term "foreigner" implies an outsider, someone inherently different and perhaps even unwelcome. It lacks the nuance and respect that should be given to individuals from diverse backgrounds.
There are far more appropriate and welcoming terms available. "Westerner," while not perfect, could be more inclusive and respectful in many contexts.
Even here in Canada, I've encountered this term used by Chinese people. It's particularly jarring to experience this in my own country, where l am a citizen. This highlights the need for greater awareness and sensitivity around the use of this term, not just in other countries but also within our own communities.

title: American friends, plasma is also very im
text:
Plasma is the liquid part of blood, which usually accounts for about 55% of the total blood volume. It contains a variety of protein, electrolytes, hormones, nutrients and metabolic wastes, and plays a vital role in maintaining the stability of the internal environment and transporting substances. The main components of plasma include water, protein, glucose, amino acids, lipids, minerals and gases. Among them, water accounts for more than 90% of the total volume of plasma and is the most important component in plasma. Protein mainly includes albumin, globulin and fibrinogen, which play an important role in maintaining plasma osmotic pressure, transporting substances and participating in immune response. In addition, plasma also contains a certain amount of electrolytes, such as sodium, potassium and chlorine, which are of great significance for maintaining ion balance inside and outside cells and neuromuscular function.

title: My TT Refugee Story (aka Insta Escape)
text:
Short version: I'm in my healing era, and this is my chance to start fresh and more
"anonymous" (ironic, considering how many Rednote users there are).
 
Long version: I've always loved content creation-not for fame or trends, but for the artistic and aesthetic joy of it (Iâ€™ve never been famous or viral). But everything changed in 2021 when I became a mom.
My pregnancy was rough, I lost myself, my energy, and my confidence. I tried posting, but the internet felt more toxic-full of judgment because "you're a mom now, act like one."
 
When my second baby was born in 2023, I left social media entirely. But I missed creating. Then, I saw a makeup artist mention her "retreat" to Rednote, and here I am. Nobody I know uses this app (family, friends or my colleagues) so l finally feel free to create, share, and enjoy myself again.
 
Thanks for reading!

title: the first thing of tiktokrefugee
text:
"Hi, #TikTokRefugees! Whatâ€™s the first thing you need to do after joining this new platform? Thatâ€™s right, get yourself a Chinese name! Now, letâ€™s create your perfect Chinese name!"
(å—¨ï¼Œå„ä½#TikTokRefugeeï¼Œæ¥åˆ°è¿™ä¸ªæ–°å¹³å°åç¬¬ä¸€ä»¶äº‹æƒ…æ˜¯ä»€ä¹ˆï¼Ÿæ²¡é”™ï¼Œå½“ç„¶æ˜¯æœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªä¸­æ–‡åå­—ã€‚ç°åœ¨ï¼Œè®©æˆ‘ä»¬åˆ›é€ ä¸€ä¸ªä¸­æ–‡åå­—ã€‚)
"Usually, we break down the syllables of the name, find Chinese characters with similar pronunciations, and then consider the meanings of those characters to choose the perfect name."
(é€šå¸¸æƒ…å†µä¸‹ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬ä¼šå°†åå­—çš„éŸ³èŠ‚æ‹†å¼€ï¼Œæ‰¾åˆ°å‘éŸ³ç›¸ä¼¼çš„ä¸­æ–‡æ±‰å­—ï¼Œç„¶åç»“åˆæ±‰å­—çš„å«ä¹‰æ¥é€‰å®šåˆé€‚çš„åå­—ã€‚)
"Take 'William' as an example. We can break it down into 'å¨' (WÄ“i) and 'å»‰' (LiÃ¡n). 'å¨' represents power and authority, while 'å»‰' symbolizes integrity and honesty. This way, 'å¨å»‰' keeps the similar pronunciation and adds meaningful cultural depth."
(ä»¥å¨å»‰ä¸ºä¾‹ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å¯ä»¥å°† 'William' æ‹†åˆ†æˆ 'å¨' å’Œ 'å»‰'ï¼Œ'å¨'ï¼ˆWÄ“iï¼‰ä»£è¡¨åŠ›é‡å’Œå¨ä¸¥ï¼Œ'å»‰'ï¼ˆLiÃ¡nï¼‰è±¡å¾æ­£ç›´å’Œæ¸…å»‰ã€‚è¿™æ ·ï¼Œ'å¨å»‰' ä¸ä»…ä¿ç•™äº†å‘éŸ³ç›¸ä¼¼ï¼Œè¿˜èµ‹äºˆäº†æ·±åˆ»çš„æ–‡åŒ–å†…æ¶µã€‚)

title: My TT Refugee Story (aka Insta Escape)
text:
Short version: I'm in my healing era, and this is my chance to start fresh and more
"anonymous" (ironic, considering how many Rednote users there are).
 
Long version: I've always loved content creation-not for fame or trends, but for the artistic and aesthetic joy of it (Iâ€™ve never been famous or viral). But everything changed in 2021 when I became a mom.
My pregnancy was rough, I lost myself, my energy, and my confidence. I tried posting, but the internet felt more toxic-full of judgment because "you're a mom now, act like one."
 
When my second baby was born in 2023, I left social media entirely. But I missed creating. Then, I saw a makeup artist mention her "retreat" to Rednote, and here I am. Nobody I know uses this app (family, friends or my colleagues) so l finally feel free to create, share, and enjoy myself again.
 
Thanks for reading!
 
#ttrefugee #ttrefugeeæŠ–éŸ³éš¾æ°‘ #ttrefugeestory #æ¯æ€§ #æ¯äº²ä¹‹æ—… #storyofmylife #healingera

Huan Shi Chang' an-The Fantasies of Chang' an
Structured in a four-part musical form, this piece unfolds like a scroll painting, depicting the grandeur of worship ceremonies with their drums and fast-beat music during the Tang Dynasty. The composition blends various woodwinds, qin, percussions, Udu and gongs to elicit the timbres described in Sun Tzu's The Art of War.

title: TIKTOK REFUGEEæˆ‘å­¦ä¹ ä¸­æ–‡ with these apps
text:
Iâ€™m a tiktok refugee like you, and iâ€™m learning Chinese with these apps.
- Hello Chinese (my favorite, native chinese speakers, great for spoken language practice. It has simulated conversations where it role plays with you and you converse vocally for the lesson)
 
- å°çº¢ä¹¦(xiaohongshu). Little Red Book: thereâ€™s a ton of content created by chinese teachers that i am learning from. Find your favorites and follow them! å°çº¢ä¹¦+Hello Chinese has taught me the most
- duolingo (i wish i found Hello Chinese first)
 
- HanziPro (from a creator here on rednote. A spaced-repitition driven flash card app. great so far!)
- Chineasy (it is great and i think i would love it, visual learning for hanzi. But only the first 8 levels are free)
- Anki (spaced reputition flash cards. I downloaded a deck from online with many vocabulary and i think it will be good once i have more knowledge, but i need some additional context to help with learning Hanzi.)  #tiktok_refugee #learnchinese #nihao

title: Uses of WeChat
text:
Hi, tt refugees, do you know uses of WeChat? If you want to make friends in China, WeChat is a best App.
 
1. Communication: WeChat is an instant messaging App that allows text, voice, and video chats, as well as sending pictures and files, making it convenient for users to communicate with family, friends, and colleagues.
2. Social interaction: You can share daily life, view friends' dynamics, like, comment, and interact in WeChat Moments.
3 Payment: WeChat payment can transfer money, send red packet, make payments, and pay bills, which is convenient and fast.
4. Mini Programs: WeChat Mini Programs can provide various services, such as ordering meals, shopping, taking taxis, and traveling, without downloading additional apps.
5 Official Accounts: WeChat official accounts can follow various media, companies, and individuals to obtain news, information, services, and other information.
6 File Management: WeChat can collect chat records, files, pictures, voice, etc., which is convenient for searching and management.
7 Service Accounts: WeChat service accounts can provide various public services, such as making appointments, checking social insurance, and handling business.
8 Enterprise WeChat: Enterprise WeChat can conduct internal communication, collaboration, and management within the enterprise to improve work efficiency. WeChat has a wide range of uses, covering almost every aspect of peopleâ€™s daily lives. It is a very practical software.
#china #wechat #tiktok #tiktokrefugee #usa #american #learnchinese

Then while playing é€†æ°´å¯’, I had a bold idea. What if they could come and play a game that is fully immersed in traditional Chinese culture and celebrate the CNY in the game? They could stroll through ancient-style towns, wear traditional clothing, make cool Chinese net-friends, and so on. How amazing?

title: Uses of WeChat
text:
Hi, tt refugees, do you know uses of WeChat? If you want to make friends in China, WeChat is a best App.
 
1. Communication: WeChat is an instant messaging App that allows text, voice, and video chats, as well as sending pictures and files, making it convenient for users to communicate with family, friends, and colleagues.
2. Social interaction: You can share daily life, view friends' dynamics, like, comment, and interact in WeChat Moments.
3 Payment: WeChat payment can transfer money, send red packet, make payments, and pay bills, which is convenient and fast.
4. Mini Programs: WeChat Mini Programs can provide various services, such as ordering meals, shopping, taking taxis, and traveling, without downloading additional apps.
5 Official Accounts: WeChat official accounts can follow various media, companies, and individuals to obtain news, information, services, and other information.
6 File Management: WeChat can collect chat records, files, pictures, voice, etc., which is convenient for searching and management.
7 Service Accounts: WeChat service accounts can provide various public services, such as making appointments, checking social insurance, and handling business.
8 Enterprise WeChat: Enterprise WeChat can conduct internal communication, collaboration, and management within the enterprise to improve work efficiency. WeChat has a wide range of uses, covering almost every aspect of peopleâ€™s daily lives. It is a very practical software.
#china #wechat #tiktok #tiktokrefugee #usa #american #learnchinese

Then while playing é€†æ°´å¯’, I had a bold idea. What if they could come and play a game that is fully immersed in traditional Chinese culture and celebrate the CNY in the game? They could stroll through ancient-style towns, wear traditional clothing, make cool Chinese net-friends, and so on. How amazing?

title: Cat tax? çŒ«ç¨ï¼Ÿ
text:
Chinese Friends, why do you ask for the "cat tax"?
ä¸­å›½æœ‹å‹ä»¬ï¼Œä½ ä»¬ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆè¦æ±‚å¾æ”¶â€œçŒ«ç¨â€å‘¢ï¼Ÿ
I understand that cats are very cute and here in America we too enjoy looking at cats. I am curious however if the cat tax is a cultural thing, or simply a joke that has arisen with the influx of Americans into xiaohongshu?
 
Also, in America we have slang where we call cats cars, as the letter r is right next to t on our keyboards, so it is a common spelling error that many have started to do on purpose, since the noise a cat makes is similar to a car engine. Is there a similar slang in Mandarin? Thanks!

çœ‹åˆ°å¾ˆå¤šå¤–å›½å‹äººå¥½å¥‡ä¸ºå•¥è¦äº¤çŒ«ç¨ï¼Œäºæ˜¯æˆ‘æƒ³ç¨å¾®è§£é‡Šä¸€ä¸‹
Seeing that many foreign friends are curious about why they have to pay the cat tax, I would like to explain a little.
æˆ‘è§‰å¾—å¯èƒ½æœ‰ä¸‰ä¸ªåŸå› ï¼Œç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªæ˜¯å›åº”å¤–å›½æ”¿åºœè¯´çš„ä¸­å›½äººæ°‘æ”»å‡»æ€§å¤ªå¼ºï¼Œäº¤çŒ«ç¨æ˜¯æˆ‘ä»¬å¯¹å¤–å›½æ”¿åºœçš„ä¸€ä¸ªè°ƒä¾ƒä»é¹…è›‹å‡ºç°çš„ä¸€ä¸ªæ¢—ã€‚
ç¬¬äºŒä¸ªæ˜¯æˆ‘ä»¬éƒ½å–œæ¬¢çŒ«ï¼Œè¿™æ ·ä¼šæœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªå…±åŒè¯é¢˜ï¼Œä»¥ä¾¿æ›´å¥½äº¤æµã€‚
ç¬¬ä¸‰æ˜¯å½“å¤–å›½äººé—®â€œæˆ‘ä»¬éœ€è¦äº¤ç¨å—â€æˆ‘ä»¬å›ç­”â€œäº¤ä¸ªæ¯›ç¨â€è¿™ä¸ªæ¯›çš„æ„æ€æ˜¯æ—¥å¸¸ç”¨è¯­é‡Œçš„ä¸ç”¨ã€‚è€Œâ€œæ¯›â€å’Œâ€œçŒ«â€åœ¨ä¸­æ–‡é‡ŒåŒéŸ³ï¼Œäºæ˜¯å˜æˆäº†äº¤ä¸ªçŒ«ç¨ã€‚
I think there may be three reasons. The first is that in response to foreign governments saying that the Chinese people are too aggressive, paying the cat tax is a joke that we make fun of foreign governments.
The second is that we all like cats, so we can have a common topic for better communication.
Third, when foreigners ask, "Do we need to pay taxes?" We answer, "äº¤ä¸ªæ¯›ç¨." This æ¯› means no in everyday language. "æ¯›" and "çŒ«ï¼ˆcatï¼‰" have the same pronunciation in Chinese, so it becomes paying a cat tax.
If you have any questions about the Internet language, you can ask me. I am a college student and I am very idle now.#å¤–å›½å‹äºº #refugees

title: American friends, plasma is also very im
text:
Plasma is the liquid part of blood, which usually accounts for about 55% of the total blood volume. It contains a variety of protein, electrolytes, hormones, nutrients and metabolic wastes, and plays a vital role in maintaining the stability of the internal environment and transporting substances. The main components of plasma include water, protein, glucose, amino acids, lipids, minerals and gases. Among them, water accounts for more than 90% of the total volume of plasma and is the most important component in plasma. Protein mainly includes albumin, globulin and fibrinogen, which play an important role in maintaining plasma osmotic pressure, transporting substances and participating in immune response. In addition, plasma also contains a certain amount of electrolytes, such as sodium, potassium and chlorine, which are of great significance for maintaining ion balance inside and outside cells and neuromuscular function.
